concept.title: Spare Parts Replacement Schedule

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Describes Reality spare-parts replacement schedule considerations, lifecycle impacts, approved-equivalent guidance and environmental factors that affect replacement cycles.

othermeta.name: entities
othermeta.content: spare parts; ambient temperature; load; vibration; chemical exposure; suppliers; replacement schedule; approved equivalent

othermeta.name: usecase
othermeta.content: Provide guidance and schedules for replacement of spare parts during the operational lifecycle of Reality systems

messagepanel.howtoavoid: Always use Reality original equipment spare parts or Reality approved equivalent.

conbody.p: During the Reality lifetime spare parts can change, for example, due to design updates, obsolescence or supplier changes. A technical and functional approved equivalent spare part will then be available.
No responsibility or liability is assumed by Reality if replacements are done with other spare parts than those delivered by Reality.

messagepanel.howtoavoid: The replacement cycles in the replacement schedules assume normal operation and can be different depending on multiple conditions. For example: The replacement cycles are based on an ambient temperature of 40°C (104°F) and a load of 70%. If one or both of the values are continuously exceeded, the parts must be replaced earlier. The replacement cycles can also be shorter and the scope extended if the system is exposed to harsh environmental conditions, for example, to vibration, harsh climate, chemicals or air-pollution.
